intro: Carduus semipinnatus, commonly known as the lesser hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and serrated, lobed leaves. Its yellow flowers bloom from summer to autumn, and it is often found in disturbed soils, roadsides, and waste areas. The plant is also known for its ability to spread through rhizomes, making it a persistent weed in certain environments.
